com.github.sahasatvik.math

Class ExpressionParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.sahasatvik.math.MathParser
      • com.github.sahasatvik.math.ExpressionParser

  • public class ExpressionParser
extends MathParser
    ExpressionParser provides methods for evaluating mathematical expressions, specifically tailored for parsing with this library. ExpressionParser supports basic arithmetic operators, parenthesized expressions, variable substitution as well as basic functions.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0, 16/10/2016
    Author:
    Satvik Saha
    See Also:
    MathParser

    • Field Detail

      • numberRegex

        protected static final java.lang.String numberRegex
        Regex which matches a number. It may be signed or use scientific notation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • signedNumberRegex

        protected static final java.lang.String signedNumberRegex
        Regex which matches a signed number. It may use scientific notation.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • assignmentRegex

        protected static final java.lang.String assignmentRegex
        Regex which matches an assignment statement. It is simply a word, followed by an equals sign (=) and an expression.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • operators

        protected static final java.lang.String[] operators
        Array of supported operators. The operators are arranged in their order of precedence. Thus, operators to the left will be evaluated before those to the right.

      • variables

        public java.lang.String[][] variables
        Array of variables maintained by an ExpressionParser object. The first String in each line stores the variable name, whicle the second stores the value.

      • numberOfVars

        public int numberOfVars
        Index of the last variable in the 'variables' array. Elements in the 'variables' array after this index are all blank, so they are not parsed during expression evaluation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExpressionParser

        public ExpressionParser(int maxVars)
        Constructor of ExpressionParser. This constructor initializes the variable cache with the specified maximum size.
        Parameters:
        maxVars - the maximum number of variables to be stored
        Since:
        1.0

    • Method Detail

      • addVariable

        public void addVariable(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String value)
        Adds a variable to the variable cache. This method accepts the variable name, as well as the String each occurrence is to be substituted with.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable
        value - the value the variable holds
        Since:
        1.0

      • evaluate

        public java.lang.String evaluate(java.lang.String exp)
                          throws ExpressionParserException
        Evaluates a String representation of a mathematical expression into a number (stored as a String).
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to be evaluated
        Returns:
        the result after evaluating the expression
        Throws:
        NullExpressionException - thrown when the expression is empty
        ExpressionParserException - thrown when the expression cannot be parsed
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        addVariable(String, String), parseVariables(String), parseParenthesis(String), parseFunctions(String), parseOperators(String)

      • parseVariables

        protected java.lang.String parseVariables(java.lang.String exp)
                                   throws VariableNotFoundException
        Substitutes all instances of the variables in the cache with their values. A variable name present in the expression must be enclosed within angled brackets (<, >) in order to be recognized. For example, if x = 10.0, then all instances of <x> will be replaced with 10.0
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to be parsed
        Returns:
        the expression after substituting known values of variables stored in the cache
        Throws:
        VariableNotFoundException - thrown when an unrecognized variable name is found in the expression
        Since:
        1.0

      • parseParenthesis

        protected java.lang.String parseParenthesis(java.lang.String exp)
                                     throws ExpressionParserException
        Substitutes expressions within parenthesis ((, )) with their results. This ensures that while evaluating an expression containing parenthesized parts, those parenthesized parts are evaluated first. This is done so that ExpressionParser follows the BODMAS rule.
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to be parsed
        Returns:
        the expression such that all parenthesized parts have been evaluated
        Throws:
        UnmatchedBracketsException - thrown when brackets in the expression are not closed
        ExpressionParserException - thrown if the parenthesized sections cannot be parsed
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        indexOfMatchingBracket(String, int, char, char)

      • parseFunctions

        protected java.lang.String parseFunctions(java.lang.String exp)
                                   throws ExpressionParserException
        Substitutes all occurrences of supported mathematical functions with their result. A function must be present in the expression in the following format : function_name[function_argument], where the function argument can also be an expression. The function name must be exactly 3 characters long, and be immediately followed by a sqaure bracket ([). See MathParser.solveUnaryFunction(String, double) for a list of supported function names.
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to be parsed
        Returns:
        the expression such that all instances of functions are evaluated
        Throws:
        MissingOperandException - thrown if there is no function argument
        FunctionNotFoundException - thrown when an unrecognized function name is found in the expression
        UnmatchedBracketsException - thrown when a square bracket is not closed
        ExpressionParserException - thrown if the function argument cannot be parsed
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        MathParser.solveUnaryFunction(String, double)

      • parseOperators

        protected java.lang.String parseOperators(java.lang.String exp)
                                   throws MissingOperandException
        Substitutes all binary expressions involving arithmetic operators with their result. Operations are performed following the BODMAS rule. The resultant parsed String is free of all operators, thus containing only numbers. See MathParser.solveBinaryOperation(double, String, double) for a list of supported operators. See operators, which defines the order of operations.
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to be parsed
        Returns:
        the expression such that all arithmetic operations have been carried out
        Throws:
        MissingOperandException - thrown if a binary operator is missing an operand
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        MathParser.solveBinaryOperation(double, String, double)

      • adjustNumberSpacing

        protected static java.lang.String adjustNumberSpacing(java.lang.String exp)
        Adjusts the spacings between numbers, variables, functions, operators, etc in an expression. Each number will be enclosed withhin a 'buffer' of spaces. Instances of signed numbers immediately following anothoer number will be interpreted as their sum. ( 1 -1 is simply 1 + -1)
        Parameters:
        exp - the expression to be parsed
        Returns:
        the expression with adjusted spacing
        Since:
        1.0

      • indexOfMatchingBracket

        protected static int indexOfMatchingBracket(java.lang.String str,
                                            int pos,
                                            char open,
                                            char close)
                                     throws UnmatchedBracketsException
        Finds the index of a matching closing bracket in a String, given the index of the opening one. This method can also be given any characters as opening and closing brackets. Nesting of brackets has also been dealt with.
        Parameters:
        str - the String containing the brackets
        pos - the index of the opening bracket
        open - the character to be recognized as an opening bracket
        close - the character to be recognized as a closing bracket
        Returns:
        the index of the matching closing bracket
        Throws:
        UnmatchedBracketsException - thrown if the specified opening bracket is unclosed
        Since:
        1.0
